Articles.Content:
Sorry My English is not good.









PARTS
1.TG-Command module
2.Orbital Lab
3.Engine
4.Antenna
5.SolarPane
6.DockingPort

7.rcs

 


Issues/Bugs
It uses the IVA from the Squad's "MPL"
I hope to solve those problems later.

If you like this MOD,Understanding my hard work.Support me to continue to develop.please consider being kind and donating a few bucks through PayPal.

DOWNLOAD ON SPACEDOCK  V 0.3.5 


DOENLOAD ON curseforge  V0.3.3

 

My other MOD : 

Chang'e 3 Lunar Lander & Yutu Lunar Rover

Chinese version Release (中文版)

License:CC BY-NC-SA 4.0


Changelog:

Spoiler

V0.3.5: delete -TG_dockingPort

V0.3.4:Repaired BUG by crew

 

V0.3.3:

1.Chinese localization

2.Repaired BUG node by DockingPort

 

V0.3.2:

1Chinese localization

 

V0.3.1:
1.Adaptation KSP1.3.1
2.Chinese localization

V0.2.2:
1.added a new parts :rcs,(Relatively simple,Half an hour to do this.Temporarily make up for defects)
2.texture format:All the texture are replaced with 'DDS'
V0.2.1:
1.re painting image for dockingPort!
2.Fix some bugs for engine.Thrust modified to 0.98KN
3.added a save 'TianGong-1.craft'
       (Released on 2015-11-25)
V0.2.0:'Command module' Re modeling ,All imges re painting,Fix some bugs
V0.1.5:added a new parts :DockingPort
V0.1.4:added a new parts :SolarPanels
V0.1.3:Delete Chinese on cfg
V0.1.2:added a new parts :Antenna
V0.1.1:Repaired BUG node by engine
V0.1.0:MOD Release

 

Edited November 17, 2017 by 54znzn
Update content

It looks very nice, but the OP is just...unreadable? I know, you mentioned that you can't really speak english, but maybe somebody here from the community could translate the chinese into proper english?

I agree with Kartoffelkuchen. This is taken from the Forum Community Rules:

[B]2.4 Language, placement spelling and grammar

[LIST=a]
[*]Users must make an effort to place a new thread in the right forum section. Posts deemed to be in an incorrect section will be moved to a proper one;
[*]Users must attempt to use proper grammar and spelling in all messages. Txt-speak, 1337-speak and other exclusionary forms of speech are prohibited; and
[*]All messages outside of the international sections [U]must be in English[/U].
[/LIST]
[/B]

Looks pretty good, I think the Tiangong in real life is a lot shorter than the one you've made. Did you model off of reference pics? Ã¤Â½Â Ã¦Å Å Ã¤Â½Â Ã¤Â¸Å Ã©ÂÂ¢Ã§Å¡â€žÃ¤Â¸Â­Ã¦â€“â€¡Ã¥Ë†Â Ã¤Âºâ€ Ã¥Â°Â±Ã¥ÂÂ¯Ã¤Â»Â¥Ã¥â€¢Â¦

Every piece of text is written in both English and Chinese, and while it's really hard to read, it is meant to be readable. I don't think he's violating rule 2.4, but then again I'm not a moderator. :)

The top text is just a history of TianGong. The bottom text (below the pictures) is the actual meat. It's a TianGong part pack, with 4 parts (command, orbital lab, engine, antenna). It uses the IVA from the MPL. The solar panels don't work (they're just decorative at the moment), and there's no included docking port; he hopes to solve those problems later.
Rule 2.4 section C. clearly states that all messages posted outside of the international section must be in english, so I'm fairly sure that applies here as well :)

International forums don't have a dedicated Add-On section, they really don't have a choice if they want people to actually see it. I think the language rule more applies to reduce confusion in purely discussion based threads, this is an add-on and the OP clearly has an English translation albeit very basic. All good for me, and nice work!

[quote name='hab136']Every piece of text is written in both English and Chinese, and while it's really hard to read, it is meant to be readable. I don't think he's violating rule 2.4, but then again I'm not a moderator. :)

The top text is just a history of TianGong. The bottom text (below the pictures) is the actual meat. It's a TianGong part pack, with 4 parts (command, orbital lab, engine, antenna). It uses the IVA from the MPL. The solar panels don't work (they're just decorative at the moment), and there's no included docking port; he hopes to solve those problems later.[/QUOTE]

Thanks! You're right.

Since there is only a small bit of text, I guess I'll be the 1st to edit what's written. Come on, guys, it isn't too hard to help out.

@54znzn, I think you'll find this edit better gets your information out. I'd help with a direct Mandarin translation, but I know little of it.
Let's be honest, many of us here are American, and the average American's grasp of proper grammar is, often, lacking. (To say the least.) But, hey, I'm being facetious...tongue firmly in cheek. Nobody likes the grammar police. :)

Also, I think you'll find the forum requires the addition of a license to your mod. If it's there and I didn't see it, then nevermind.

Attribution[/B] Ã¢â‚¬â€ You must give [URL="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/#"]appropriate credit[/URL], provide a link to the license, and [URL="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/#"]indicate if changes were made[/URL]. You may do so in any reasonable manner, but not in any way that suggests the licensor endorses you or your use

but given how bad my "Multi-Layer Insulation Blankets"-Textures for Fustek Station Parts are blurred here on the Tiangong (and without my normal maps) I don't know if i want to be credited anyway. Still, leaves a bad taste.

All you guys quoting the rules and telling this guy how it should be done are in fact... breaking the rules yourself. For starters, you're all going off topic and hijacking his tread.

Be thankful he shared at all, if I was him, I'd get depressed, delete the thread and never say another word to you guys ever. Imagine if the tables were turned and it was you speaking in a Chinese forum?

Sorry for being wildly off topic... but I liked the offering and the words were the last thing I looked at, and always is... photos tell me more than words do.

Thank you to the OP for this share, I wanted a 'small' space station and this will be ideal.

Only thing worse than an over active Moderator is members mini modding a person.

:(
